Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff, tired Hotel, adequate room”
Reviews.Author: TheShake
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with the Hotel, it just feels very tired. I found the staff very pleasant and helpful however; room was comfortable and had a good night sleep; just don't expect any wow factor

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Farleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and were very impressed with not only the excellent location, but the courtesy and efficiency of the staff. The bedrooms were adequate for our needs - very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are a bit tired and could do with a facelift, but very clean. No goodies offered such as shower caps etc and they have shower curtains and those awful squeegee soap dispensers in the shower, which I hate. The staff are all extremely pleasant and helpful and cannot be faulted. A good choice of breakfasts too. For a few days in London it's excellent value for money. As I said before, the location is ideal and I will be staying again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a Let down”
Reviews.Author: Lancastergirl
Reviews.Content: Used the Hotel as a base to explore the city on ashort break with my son, The room was big enough and my son loved the view of the BT tower!!, heating unitwas very load andhad to turn it off on 1st ight as kept waking me up. Walls very thin as could hear the guets in the next room talking and this was in the middle of the night. Had Breakfast 1 morning 1 word awful, no fried eggs, overcooked bacon, scrambled egg was like water hash browns overcooked and someone had turned th top grill of the toaster off and took 5 min to cook my toast!!. Never went the next morning!!!. Would use again as location is excellant!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service lets the hotel down”
Reviews.Author: TheYorkshireRambler
Reviews.Content: It's never a good start when you can't check into a hotel because the computers aren't working. The receptionist, although pleasant, had fairly poor English skills and was struggling to find the words to explain what was going on. We sat in the bar and waited....and waited and eventually got into our room an hour late. I asked reception for another pillow - took a while to explain what a pillow was - and I guess she didn't understand because the pillow never did turn up. I went to reception to ask about it but after queueing for 15 minutes I just gave up. Service in the restaurant was hit and miss. Some staff were really good and on-the-ball but some didn't seem to know what they were doing. We noticed a lot of inconsistencies between the 2 nights we stayed and ate in the restaurant. Food in the restaurant was ok in the evening - meat was lovely but vegetables were cooked too far in advance and were mushy. Breakfast was terrible - fried egg was rock solid, bacon was nice, sausages were cheap and greasy and beans were stone cold. Room was spacious considering the location being in central London. Cleanliness was ok just about everywhere - although I didn't look too closely. Air conditioning unit was very, very noisy though and kept waking us up. Saw a mouse running through the lobby...wasn't too sure what to make of that. Facilities generally are good - ice machine on each floor and concierge. Just seemed expensive for what it was. Possibly would stay again due to good location but would try to find somewhere better first!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Simone17889
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel is the super location. The property could do with a bit of sprucing up. As I said the location is good. A tad bit expensive but then your in central London. Also the rooms were small. Thin walls. But good service.

Reviews.Title: “expensive for averageness”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCheung
Reviews.Content: normally stay here when on business. The rooms are ok, nothing to shout home about. The location is good. Service is slightly above average, always seems to be understaffed. Breakfast is poor, please avoid this on the weekends, way too busy, and not worth the wait. Expensive too. Dont really recommend this, but if you have no other choice, its still choose-able.

Reviews.Title: “A faded star”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: A beautiful building from the outside however the grace has lapsed on the inside. It was however clean and the staff were helpful. The breakfast was plentiful however avoid the bready substandard sausages and the boiled mushrooms - and some of the waiting staff who, whilst being very attentive and friendly could have used anti-perspirant. The room itself was big enough with a decent shower and always plenty of hot water - the downside was that the plug didn't fit so shaving was a problem and when the plug was wedged shut with a flannel we found that the overflow wasn't attached and the water poured out over the floor. Generally though we had a good stay and would revisit. Interestingly the basement toilet facilities were extremely modern and newly fitted - if this standard were to be applied to the rest of the hotel then this would be a gem as the location is central but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Shadowfaxlancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The room was OK, the bathroom was clean and there was a window which opened which is always a nice thing in these over heated hotels. The hotel however is in an excellent area with a conveninet ncp car park just down the street, its just behind Debenhams on oxford street. The check in staff were rushed off their feet and got interrupted all the time - the concierge who should have been handling some of the problems kept wandering off. The breakfast was nothing special considering this is a reasonably classed hotel, the sausages were cheap and nasty. We stayed here on a business trip and would stay here again for it's convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor stay (make sure you ask for a quiet room)”
Reviews.Author: ljn_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on business. From the outside the hotel looked promising but inside it is dated (seems to be undergoing a refurb as many hallways smelt strongly of paint) Check in set the tone - the person checking me in was constantly distracted - when another guest came down as their key card was not working despite being midway through checking me in she left me standing there as she went off to serve them! - she seemed to keep getting distracted by lots of other things and at no time did I feel I had her full attention. My colleague was being checked in (by another front desk clerk) at the same time but my check in took more than twice as long. Also despite confirming my loyalty card number she failed to enter it - I am now trying to get the pointed added retrospectively. Location: Good for tourists who wish to shop - located behind Debenhams, close to tube station. Room: I was assigned a room facing the road (my colleague was given a room towards the back & reported later her room was very quiet) As the location is set away from the main road (hotel is on a street behind Debenhams) I did not give it a second thought but would regret this later when I returned to the room to sleep. Room was on 2nd floor Colour palette of room was quite dark/dated decor Cheap looking dark wood furniture (table, chair, bedside cabinet etc) Window was single glazed and so provided no noise insulation (did not realise how bad this was till I tried to sleep - at night I could hear every car go by, peoples conversations on the street as they walked by etc) - I lost count of the number of times I woke up during the night. Bathroom had bath & shower - No mini toiletries - just a large tube of Dove attached to the wall Sheets - ave - low quality - added bonus was the hairs (not mine) I later discovered on one side of the bed :- ( Flatscreen TV - picture quality was so poor that on some channels it was barely watchable My colleague had a room set back from the road - and whilst their room had a similarly dated decor, it was super quiet - so might be worth asking for a quiet room when checking in. We had an early meeting so decided to skip breakfast so can't comment on that Compared to the other Holiday Inn I usual stay at in London (Bloomsbury) this was quite poor, given the choice I will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE....WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: miamiman
Reviews.Content: Just as we expect to find at a HI....Good service...Nice room....A pity the parking is extra but at least its only a few yards down the road....We will be staying again later in the year....9/10

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mcress79
Reviews.Content: Good location for shopping and going out, just behind Debenhams on Oxford Street. Clean hotel, looked like the room had been newly decorated and was clean and everything i needed for a one night stay. Stay pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: fififiona
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights. Simple, clean rooms however walls are paper thin. The floor we stayed on was getting a Reno do all day there were jackhammers and similar noise as well as dirt, rubbish and lots of dust in the corridor - great for asthmatics. Breakfast was so overpriced and was generally edible with the exception of the eggs, hash browns, sausages and croissants. Waiting staff was polite. Above all, the receptionists were terrible - no customer service skills at all. Not helpful in the slightest and speak to each other and the customers with the rudest demeanor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: camster66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. 5 Minutes walk from Oxford Street but on a quiet side street, surrounded by a number of quaint and interesting streets. The rooms- well appointed and reasonable in siz with good quality furniture and tv bathroom- lage- spotless with bath and shower punlic areas and restraurant- well kept, good food at reasonable cost staff- friendly for London Overall Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: LAPO76
Reviews.Content: It is a very central hotel in the middle of the shopping / theatre area. It was perfect for us and I admit they surprised me at the reception for the way they greeted and accommodated all of our needs promptly and with a smile. The main observation is simply that the hotel is dated and it definitely requires works as it is not up to the level of the others newer holiday Inns or Crown Plazas. We got an executive room on the top floor. It was good enough for us, but I have to admit that we weren't paying as it was on my priority club account. Basically, I would have never paid 240-260£ to sleep in a hotel in those conditions... and if I would have charged that kind of money I would be SERIOUSLY furious! :) Also... if they paint the walls to remove stains... once finished they should also remove the tape which was left there for the whole weekend... the paint was definitely dry!... as a matter of favour... can you please remove it? Please? So next time I will not have the feeling to sleep in a building site? Also... thanks for asking at the reception what newspaper I wanted... but that was all about it... I had to buy it myself at the Tesco the following day! Definitely ROOM for improvement in there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bacs_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting for shopping and the theatre. Excellent location and not a bad price as good London hotels go. Decent sized room, clean although some filler missing between a small number of tiles around bath. Efficient check in and concierge was cheerful and helpful. Room was quiet, despite overlooking very busy area. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SturtonRover
Reviews.Content: Good hotel we stayed two nights including new years eve 2012, clean in all areas, Very helpful Friendly staff, Breakfast was good empty plates soon removed, Bar service was good pricrs ok Last time we stayed in London we stay at holiday Inn Regent park it was not as good will return to Holiday Inn Oxford Circus

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: awoods
Reviews.Content: I coerced 6 business colleagues to stay in this hotel rather than the conference hotel in Victoria. All have come back to me and thanked me for making this their hotel for the trip. It is in a quiet largely residential area, less than 5 minutes walk of Oxford Street, or Marylebone High Street. OK it is not the most flash, or anywhere near boutique - but the staff are friendly, the room clean and comfortable and the breakfast is a lot better than many hotels I have eaten at. Thank you Holiday Inn Oxford Circus

Reviews.Title: “nice mini business hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlelebanon
Reviews.Content: very basic hotel and meant for business stays. its location is amazing-5 minutes from bond station and a walk to oxford.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: RnRLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last weekend. Its a really nice hotel - mid range. Quiet at night and comfortable beds for good sleeping conditions. Its an excellent location for shopping on Oxford Street, Regent Street and the area around here and the nearest tube station is Bond Street which is very central. I would highly recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Delight”
Reviews.Author: Watfordchaps
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of London's west end shops, this hotel lies one road behind Denenhams Oxford street, so ladies if you like to shop til you drop this is the location for you. The hotel itself is clean,tidy,rooms are standard Holiday Inn, bar in lobby very average but the location is the big plus point.There is an old world type pub two mins from hotel, small but cosy and there are various style restaurants within a few minutes walk in each direction of the hotel.Transport is easy, buses on Oxford street, Bond street tube station all a few mins walk away, we stay here if we want a weekend shopping spree,theatre weekend or for some good dining and wine around Covent Garden/ Leicester Square it's so central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: scuba_in_the_sun
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, really convenient 5min walk to Oxford Street and Bond Street shopping, whilst being nice and quiet as not on a busy street, which is not easy to find (as often being near shops means hotel is in or near a noisy/busy road) Staff friendly, efficient, fast check in, checkout, in room dining food order arrived both nights in only 15minutes. Room nice and clean, good free tv channels included Sky Sports 1/2/3 on large flat screen tv, Would definitely stay here again when I am in London, especially .if I want to do some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: insearchofaholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my mum and sister. This was our 4th stay at the hoel as it is a great location for a london shoppping trip. Room was fine with a double and a single. Three singles would be better and we always ask but this is what we are given. There is no frills with this hotel but breakfast is very good. Walls are thin, the man in the room next door to us talked on his phone ALL night so not a great nights sleep but you get this is good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in London”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda03
Reviews.Content: I have just returned October 28th, from a two week stay at the Holiday Inn Oxford Circus. My daughter and I went for shopping and theatres and general siteseeing. I was born in London so know it well. Our main reason for choosing this hotel was for its close proximity to the West End and all the major shops and it certainly did not disappoint us. The hotel is located in a quiet street about four minutes from Oxford Street - very close to Debenhams Department Store. It is about a five minute walk to Bond Street underground station and very close to many buses which will take you all over the city. We found the room was small but adequate and the bathroom very good. The hotel staff were very helpful and we had no problems at all with the staff. We were pleased to see that there was a full size computer in the lobby which we used constantly. The charge for the computer was 5pounds for one hour or 3pounds for half an hour. They had a buffet breakfast which was included in our package. The buffet consisted of a full cooked breakfast and also continental including fruit, cheese, yoghurts, pasteries, cereals etc. etc. If you would like omelettes they would cook them on request. We wanted cream with our coffee (rather than the milk they seem to use in their coffees) and that was no problem at all. We found the breakfast staff attentive and helpful you just had to ask and they would provide! There were plenty of free newspapers in the lobby every day so you didn't have to buy them. One tip re general travel in London. We purchased London Transport Travel tickets before we left Canada for 50pounds per week. These tickets cost a lot less if you purchase outside the UK. These tickets covered all six zones on light trains, underground trains, trams, buses.and meant that you could hop on and off all forms of transport with ease. It also eliminated the long line ups. You have to request them well in advance from your travel agent as the actual tickets are sent in the mail. We used them on a couple of long train rides which extended the 6 zones but we were just charged a supplement so still saved a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but poor service..”
Reviews.Author: greenn00
Reviews.Content: We stayed on October 28th just for a night. Hotel location is just ideal as everything was walkable distance.We checked in around four in the afternoon, receptionist was very pleasant and helpful.We were disappointed as did not get what we requested(twin bed) and which was confirmed by the night manger before arrival.However, receptionist got us queen bed which was comfortable and spacious room.Also, was really disappointed as requested wake up call for 6:30 a.m which we did not receive at all and got delayed to head to airport. So overall was not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not great service - brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Nat P
Reviews.Content: First of all we had trouble finding the hotel and so I called ahead for directions from the tube. The phone rang and rang and rang but no-one answered. When we got there (with help from a local person) the check-in desk was deserted. We waited nearly five minutes for someone to come out to see us. When I asked why we had been kept waiting the woman (who identified herself as the duty manager, but wasn't wearing a name badge) said they were "doing a handover" and we would have to wait another five minutes. So we waited. And waited. About ten minutes later the woman came out wearing a coat and left! A young man (again with no badge) checked us in and was very nice and apologised for the delay. He offerred us a complimentary drink, but we decided against it as we just wanted to get to our room. The room was pleasant enough, old fashioned but clean and tidy with everything you'd expect in a three star hotel. The shower was a bit on the weak side, not much pressure, but the bath was deep and there was plenty of hot water and the towels were plentiful. We decided against breakfast the next day as there was a very long queue and the room looked a bit dingy (it's in a basement) but our check-out was quick and easy. I'd stay again, if I was in the area, but wouldn't put it as my first choice by a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer care”
Reviews.Author: DavidNatalie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as stopover in London. Attracted by reasonable rates and location. Hidden charges with tax to be added brought it in line with other hotels in the area. Priority member status noted by reception staff which entitled us to nothing! Not even an early check in. Staff seemed too busy to serve public then were unhelpful and poorly trained. Charges for wifi when locals all free! Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: assassin68
Reviews.Content: stayed here the weekend of 15th-16th October. nice central location just 5 minutes walk from shops in Oxford street. upon arriving ( there were 7 of us with 4 rooms) there was a problem finding our rooms which were all booked online but this was sorted after about 20 minutes. room was clean but fairly small with too much furniture for it's size. we had asked for twin room but got "double" although it was smallest double ive slept in. room looked out onto a wall and bins. hotel was quiet and staff fairly friendly. breakfast was good with cereals, toast, fruit and cooked food. although considering the 500 rooms not a very big restaurant. overall no real complaints but for £120 a night would have expected a bit more. definetly prefer premier inn to holiday inn. one thing food eaten in rooms was left on trays afterwards and no one seemed to come and clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms very average”
Reviews.Author: Tripsie
Reviews.Content: Good location, just a few minutes walk from Bond St and Oxford Circus tube stations, but located in a surprising quite area behind Oxford St (on the Wigmore St side). The room was ok,although decor is a bit tired. Size was ok for one (with a double bed), might feel a bit cramped for two if you were there for a few nights - but this is an older hotel, so room sizes probably vary. As is common in the UK (why ???) there are trouser presses, but if you want an ironing board, you will need to ask reception, and hope they have one available within a reasonable timescale. I didn't pay the exorbitant internet access fee, I went out to Starbucks,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Casey100
Reviews.Content: An average 3* hotel, could do with a re-furb, but clean and confortable enough if you don't intend to spend much time here. The best thing about this hotel is the location, just 5 minutes walk from Bond Street tube, in a quiet street just behind Oxford Street. Perfect location for shopping or tourists. I had a twin room which was big enough for one person, but would have been a squeeze for two and what little furniture the was, was too large for the limited space. Decor was tired both in the corridors and the room and duvets very thin. Bathroom was clean; small, but functional. Buffet breakfast was OK, but not great quality and could do with more choice. Get there early as there aren't many tables and queues formed quickly. The worst thing about the hotel was the service - very poor. I queued for 15minutes to check in with the queue reaching out of the door, until a second receptonist joined the desk. Check out was even worse - queued for 20 minutes, again there was only one person on reception. Several guests seemed to have queries on their bills and the manager was no-where to be found. Great location if all you're looking for is a base to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location, and a decent bed”
Reviews.Author: yvr1k
Reviews.Content: The big positives about this hotel is the location, the comfortable bed, and the bathroom is in good repair. It's seriously hit & miss to stay at a hotel in London, giving the age of infrastructure in a lot of places, and the size of most rooms being minuscule. The negatives are the old room furnishings, the cramped room size, and the general quality of the hotel. Also, it was disappointing to not have an iron & board in my room. I did request usage one morning, but it never arrived to my room. Oh well, wrinkled shirt time for my meeting. Internet usage is not free, and is quite extortionate. £16 per 24-hour period is ridiculous. Anyway, good if you have business nearby, but I'd stay somewhere else if I was on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, reasonable price for London”
Reviews.Author: Derekwozthere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just an average hotel, nothing special and nothing bad. Good for Oxford Street and Regents Street. Breakfast room is too small so expect a wait for a seat. The decor of the hotel is tired but ok. Internet access is not included and expensive. Food quality is average.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Family weekend”
Reviews.Author: Eladora
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family for a weekend in London. Brilliant location and close to tubes and Boris bike racks too. We arrived to check in and had to wait an hour as the previous occupant had requested late check out. This was a bit frustrating as we wanted to get in and exploring. However after that we didn't have any problems. Staff were reasonably friendly and the front desk were helpful. The room was smaller than some we've stayed in - BUT it is the middle of London! One thing we found odd was the lighting configuration. 2 bright ceiling lights came on when you turned on the bedside light. If you like reading in the night watch out for this! Breakfast was very good, but VERY busy - try and avoid peak times if you can. We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have coffee in the lounge area with the family and this was a nice space to sit and relax in. Would come again if we could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the cost conscious traveller in the costly city of London”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiWil
Reviews.Content: Great location was the reason why we chose this IHG amongst the 2 dozen in the heart of London. Finding it was easy - right behind the Debenhams Building at Welbeck St. It was within minutes from the nearest tube and a great hotel to rest the tried legs (and go out again) after the shopping and hours of sightseeing. It is also 6 GBP and 15min away from Euston Rail Station; if you are looking to set off early in the morning like us, hopping on a train to other parts of the UK (we went to Manchester to catch the 10 goal thriller coincidentally!!) , proximity to Euston is a big plus! I particularly find the 50% welcome beer a great gesture. Rooms are clean and economically sized. No major complains after you try a couple of hotels in big cities. No free wifi was a spoiler.

Reviews.Title: “good location. Hotel decent. no more than that”
Reviews.Author: Aviv666
Reviews.Content: It looked like a good location when I chose this hotel. Actualy I insisted to get this hotel and it was not cheap at all. Other than the location which is very close to Oxford Street and the metro, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends. We changed rooms twice. First, the room was very small and at the second time there was a problem with the hot water. After the 2nd time we did not feel like changing rooms again and just showered at our friends' room. The hotel staff was willing to give us another room but after a long day out returning almost at midnight we did not feel like packing all of our staff and moving again.

Reviews.Title: “18th Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son and daughter for 2 nights and had a lovely time. it was a surprise short break for my daughters 18th birthday. On arrival reception staff were pleasent and helpful.Rooms were comfortable and quiet.At breakfast we were greeted by a lovely member of the restaurant staff who showed us to our seats and all restaurant staff continued to be attentive during our time there. I enjoyed my stay and am planning another stay at this delighful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal, Great Location, Awesome Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: feather-boy
Reviews.Content: I had purchased flights to London for my girlfriend's birthday to see THE PREMIERE OF HARRY POTTER & THE DEATHLY HALLOWS PART 2!!!! =D and we decided to both pick the hotel. It was then that my girlfriend found us an amazing deal at the Holiday Inn on Oxford Circus. The room was stunning (big!!), staff were very friendly and the breakfast...well since we were going to be standing in the rain for 10 hours we hoped to have a filling breakfast...and we weren't disappointed!! Local underground made transportation easy and the hotel is situated just north of Mayfair, the Underground takes literally seconds to get into the heart of London - excellent location!! It helps knowing your train lines and lucky for me, I was navigator!! After returning from 10 hours in the torrential rain, we ordered some room service and had a relaxing night in. The food was gorgeous and the service was top notch. We would love to stay there again and look forward to returning =)

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive hotel. Only the location justifies this.”
Reviews.Author: MissesMoMo
Reviews.Content: I stay here for work every few months when I stay in London. It is very central, a 5 min walk form Oxford Street (john lewis end) but the hotel has very little redeeming about it. London is expensive for hotels and this is why this hotel is dear. It does not suggest quality. Breakfasts are precooked and basic. Try to avoid ground/basement rooms. Take toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “unbitted location.”
Reviews.Author: nitzan
Reviews.Content: the rooms are nice and very clean. good breakfast. the location is its major advantage. should improve their front desk service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: doliche
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel. My first stay was two years ago with my family and we enjoyed the location of the hotel too much. My last visit was a business trip and this time even the hotel is far from the place where I have my meetings, I prefered this hotel since I could easily spent my time to enjoy London's nice places in the evening. During my both stays I observed the same service quality and good staff attitude. I can advice as my favourite hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Oxford Circus Pretty Much Sums it Up”
Reviews.Author: hc546
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of Holiday Inn's worldwide. The service is good, the rooms are good, breakfast is available at extra cost. Given that it is just Off Oxford Street the price is reasonably high however for business it is a good call as rooms are generally available last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Returning guest”
Reviews.Author: jsc1165
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot for Oxford Street and just 4 minutes walk from Bond Street Tube stration, situated behind Debenhams department store. Staff are all very friendly and approachable, hotel is very clean both in room and public areas. The bed was so comfy, I didn't want to get up when I should have. After a day out and about in London visiting the sights, it was a pleasure to head 'home' for the night. Great selection of tv channels on offer. I didn't use the restaurant on this visit, but have done so in the past and it was a really good meal then. I did check out the menu and it was looking pretty fine to me. The lady on the bar was great, very friendly and couldn't do more if she tried. All in all a great place to stay while in London, would always recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Oxford Street but the walls are very thin”
Reviews.Author: Eaglet64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we went to London to see a show. It is a couple of streets north of Oxford Street and very typical of a Holiday Inn. The room was basic but comfortable but the walls were paper thin. We had to call the front desk to ask them to get the neighbours to stop shouting at their kids. Once they quietened down we managed to get a good nights sleep but were awakened to the sounds of the trains in the underground. Breakfast was included in the price and was a full English breakfast which was very good. They say you get what you pay for and we didn't expect luxury given the price we paid. This hotel is OK if you just want to get a nights sleep and aren't too fussy. It is clean, comfortable and there was plenty of hot water in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “I hated it and will never come back”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous_Aus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Oxford Circus for 10 days, and it was the worst hotel i have ever entered in my life. The receptionists were completely rude and helpless, the hotel room was squashy, with very hard beds, and a claustrophobic bathroom area. The breakfast was beyond terrible, and i had to think a several number of times before i ate there. The waiters were downright rude, and useless. The service here was poor, and i will never be attending this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolalou_7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for just over two weeks. After reading the reviews I was dreading it. The staff were all fine with me. Friendly enough. The room was clean although I think it needed hoovering a bit more. The breakfasts had pretty much everything you could want for breakfast, full English cereals fruit etc. It was my birthday while I was away and unprompted they sent me a bottle of champagne. Such a sweet thought. Downside was the evening meals. Really disappointed at the choice and quality of food. Everything tasted deep fried even the "roast" chicken. However that said the staff who worked in the restaurant and brought room service were quick and polite. I was in a smoking room even though I don't smoke, I asked if it was possible to change when I Checked in unfortunately it wasn't but was told by reception they would arrange housekeeping to come to my room if it smelt too strong but it didnt. Mini gym a waste of time, went on exercise bike and the automatic lights kept turning off!! Had to wave like a mad person to get them back on, three machines not much cop. So overall good location friendly staff, ok sized room for London. Only complaint was Quality of evening food. Think holiday inn need to overhaul the menu and have a training session with chef. Nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “My favourite London address”
Reviews.Author: gammo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel at least half a dozen times in the last five years and is my hotel of choice in london. The lobby is tiny with a check-in counter and bar all inside 500 to 600 square feet but the staff know their jobs and are efficient in the check_in process, sending of bags to your room etc . The rooms are small with the exception of a ground floor room I occupied some three years back ( which was massive ) but the beds and furniture are perfectly functional and the bathrooms pas muster in all respects,,, clean, decent fittings and spacious by London's dingy standards, Also, as a priorityclub platinum member I have been pampered with free drinking water, cookies, orange juice and toiletries on all my visits. The hotel invariably leaves some 3 or 4 magazines of high quality in the rooms and The Independent newspaper is available free of charge to all guests. The room TVs are state of the art with a really good selection of channels...particularly from the SKY network. housekeeping , too, is of a decent quality. However, the best feature of the hotel is its location, Quietly tucked away on Welbeck street it is 5 minutes from oxford street and 7 minutes walk from the great eating places on St Christophers place. i have never eaten breakfast or other meals in the restaurant in the basement so cannot comment on the same. This is not a great midpriced hotel by any means but it is definitely A VeryGoodone.

Reviews.Title: “Windows that open”
Reviews.Author: JRL12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room on the front of the hotel, whilst the room itself was pretty standard, clean, comfortable bed, choice of pillows, small bathroom, but major plus point was the windows that opened and allowed access to a small balcony. This was great for preventing that stuffy hot room syndrome created when you can't open a window, + was useful at 5 in the morning when a high pitched alarm like sound went off, was able to chck that it wasn't a proper fire alarm as no fire engines appeared at the hotel nor people congregating on the pavement. So if I could get one of these roooms again I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL and wont be going back!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieCork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 10th June 2011 with my partner, first of all it was way overpriced! The receptionists were rude openly arguing with each other very unprofessional, two customers were having separate complaints while we were checking out. The breakfast was disgusting, the room was hot and stuffy, the butter, juices and everything that was to be kept cold was warm. The sat us at a table that was literally a foot away from the waiter station so we were surrounded by 5 waiters looking at us and the dirty waiter station while we were eating. I have stayed in alot of hotels and this hotel really is rock bottom, it has no merits at all, maybe the location but thats about it!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Nell10_10
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't fault the hotel - the location is great yet it's quiet at night. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MissWright_11
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in this so call quiet hotel again! Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel on 14th May 2011 and it cost me £110 a night as part of his birthday gift. However we are appauled as there was a party going on with lots of loud noise right underneath our room! When we checked in the hotel put us in a room on the ground floor! Big mistake as this party started at 6pm and finished at midnight. The noise in our room was terrible and vibrating. We were told by a receptionist that we would have ti wait until midnight if we wanted to go to sleep! Im 8 months pregnant and was feeling very exhaused after a long day in London. Word of warning do do stay here. Note they also charge ONLY £14.95 for breakfast, do they really think most people will eat £14.95 worth of fry up! What a rip off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dont judge the hotel by its cover”
Reviews.Author: rnlg1967
Reviews.Content: I assume everyone stays here for its location, 5 mins from Oxford Circus, as there isn't much else going for it, save the price I guess. It really is rather depressing , a lot of budget London hotes are, but surely they could spend some money sprucing it up. I am asthmatic non smoker , so they stuck me i a smoking room (do these still exisit?) despite a prior request from my company for NS room. no other rooms were available and it was too late to find an alternative hotel . It was like being holed up in an ash tray- it was revolting and impossible to sleep. I had the double whammy of having some great big extractor outside the window ,so couldnt even open the window. after deciding that the bath was too small to sleep in, and reception not having any sofas , I ended up fumigating the room with Lynx spray every 5 minutes. The TV flckered on and off all the time, the remote didnt work. Some new carpet and curtains, filler ,paint and some imaginiation could work wonders on the place i am sure. i think all rooms on 4th floor are smoking- so you have been warned. as i arrived at 9.30pm I only had the on site restaurant as an option of somewhere to eat, room service was not an option given the smell. there was a carvery which sounds great, but we are talking food that had been openly displayed for at least that whole day and had turned into something not very pleasant. I had the worst meal ever, seriously- everything about it was terrible. the staff in the hotel were pleasant enough, they do as much as they can do given what they have at their disposal. The lady who greets guests into breakfast (which actually was pretty good) managed to keep smiling, whilst waiters and waitresses were attentive. So i have really slated this hotel, and this review will contradict others, but my stay was that bad. I have told my company to strike this one off the list they use, the Thistle in Marble Arch is similarly priced and 10 times better.

Reviews.Title: “In General, a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ayaarlos
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights to celebrate our honeymoon. The beginning was tough. We arrived, and although we had requested a nice quiet room the room we received was far from it. We received a room on the first floor right next to the lifts. After going back down to the reception and complaining we were transfered to a different room, quieter but the size of a shoe-box. Again, we asked to move to a different room and we were moved the next day. The new room was lovely. Really really lovely. Big and airy with a nice queen sized bed. All three rooms we saw were clean and tidy. The house-keeping staff does a good job keeping the rooms clean. Breakfast is very nice, a full English Breakfast. The only downside is that is doesn't change at all, it's the same breakfast every day. The only real problem we had was that one day, we came back to our room in the evening and discovered the door was open. The door always needed to be forcefully shut and the cleaner didn't do this. Nothing was taken, no harm done and the cleaners were advised to notice this door. The bar is ok, we sat and had a drink there a couple of times. Of course, the main good point of this hotel is it's amazing location. 7 minutes walk from the Bond St. Tube station and 7 minutes walk to Oxford circus.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Building”
Reviews.Author: papslassie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a former Edwardian home. The lobby is very lovely. This hotel is nice. Their restaurant has a wonderful menu.

Reviews.Title: “Rather dated hotel, in a good location near main shopping strip”
Reviews.Author: Matosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within 10 mins walking distance from Oxford Circus station. As I stayed at this hotel with 2 other colleagues (each to a room), we each had varying quality of rooms. One had a refurbished room with new fittings (and a window that a burglar could potentially jumped through), one had a tiny oldish room, and I had one that could be best described as well-maintained 70's styled room of a decent size. The bed was soft on one side and firm on the other (queen size), the TV was crt, the in-house movies didn't work, there was more than enough wardrobe space, the wallpaper was of a maroon colour (might be a little creepy for some) and the toilet was good for its age (no mildew or noticeable cracks etc). The reception service was moody. The staff generally seemed disinterested. The concierge was pretty helpful though. Would I return? Probably not, but for what it's worth, the hotel is of a average standard that would be OK for most.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: bks07
Reviews.Content: From the outside into the lounge, you feel you are likely to get something special. Delve into the rooms and you feel you went back in time. The receptionist was efficient in checking me in but neglected to inform us of breakfast times or even ask us if we'd like breakfast! Despite the efficiency, I felt hurried during the check in process and didn't get a chance to ask about breakfast. Therefore we chose to go to garfunkel's which is only 5mins round the corner on oxford street. If they don't want my money, I'm happy to spend it elsewhere! I got into the room only to find a very dated look. Wooden furniture, old curtains, single glazed windows with paintwork peeling off and an old crt tv with minimal channels, not to mention equipment provided that didn't work. i.e iron. During my stay, I didn't get much sleep. Thinking that some other reviewers were being over dramatic about hearing everything, I can honestly say, it's all true! I could hear the smallest of things and on each night, was woken up by who I believe was staff because I got out of bed to look through the spy hole and saw somebody open a door opposite the lifts which were clearly staff only. Clearly no respect for their guests! Housekeeping were no better, banging bin lids and rustling bin bags etc. I don't know what h/k clean when they enter the rooms because when I returned after being out all day, drinks glasses were left in the room from the previous night, the bathroom wasn't done properly but they chose to take my key card from slot without consent - which I purposefully left so the air con would remain on! There were glasses and plates left in hallways at times. The only pleasant thing to say was that the bar and lounge did have a nice look. The staff on the other hand, not so welcoming - it doesn't hurt to smile once in a while! I'm sure at times, time can go slow but surely there are better and more important things to do than sit at the end of the bar and read magazines? So show interest in your guests and perhaps they would spend more money because they feel welcome. The location is quite literally the best attribute this hotel has to offer, it's the only reason I gave it an extra star rating but to say I wouldn't return is an understatement.!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: CJMH01
Reviews.Content: Unclean Out of date Disgusting service If you a priority club member, forget it, the staff do not recognise priority club. After having appalling check-in service as a platinum member, I asked if there wad an upgrade available. I was told there wasn't one. When I pushed hard, one suddenly became available. So this suggest they do not do room upgrades for loyalty members. Not looking forward to breakfast tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms is small and service is Satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: fresh0206
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: near the underground and near the shopping area however if you have heavy luggages it's difficult. ROOMS: the room is tiny, old fashion bathroom, it's weird how they installed refillable shampoo bottle on the wall ( i think it's unsanitary you can catch something from previous guest that used it ), the television is old but the best thing in the room is there BED it's VERY comfortable. Service: the front desk are not helpful nor friendly very bland they will not go and beyond to satisfy their guest but the HOUSE KEEPING CREW are excellent friendly and helpful more than front desk which is kind of weird. OVERALL: 6.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for weekend in London!”
Reviews.Author: lucie2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night mid Feb for a friends Engagement Party. Fab location close to West End, most theatres, Oxford Street, Leicester Square, China Town, Soho, all within close walking distance! Nice welcome on Reception & speedy check in. Comfortable rooms, with plenty of tea and coffee making facilities. Nice bar too! Would definately reccomend for a city break in London!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: GroverUK
Reviews.Content: For a typical, central London hotel this wasn't so bad on price. It is a little dated in the bedrooms but they are clean and well managed. The room was of a reasonable size and offered a desk and a small table - so there was space to work too. However, the windows only seem to be single glazed in the rooms and can let in quite a bit of noise at night. Bar area is snug but clean and the staff are nice enough. The reception was helpful and got everything right with the instruction and costs on retaining all expenses on a single bill for multiple rooms. Believe me, this is a good thing after spending a work week in one place and not that common an experience. We ate in the restaurant on the first night. Waiting staff were attentive and the food was also fair and not over-priced. Breakfasts were ok too. There was plenty to choose from the buffet style breakfast bar. The best thing about this hotel is its position though. Easy to get to from Euston and a nice walk from Oxford Street and some very nice restaurants around Carnaby St, Westminster and Baker St. Covent Garden is only a 30 minute walk away too.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CENTRAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fast193
Reviews.Content: stayed here 4 a short break amazing place clean,friendly, good food , vending machines as good prices .central would go back again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Haribo16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst in the city for my partners birthday. Hotel is a 15walk from Oxford Circus station down a quiet side street. Everything within walking distance eg oxford street, regent street and harley street etc etc. Hotel was ok, facilities quite old and dated although the rooms were clean they were in need of being updated! Breakfast was very nice in the morning with plenty to choose from. Would return to this hotel for the location

Reviews.Title: “Small room, rude staff, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Travellingtes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend in November, room was very small, bed linen hard, old tv in the room, rude staff in bar and on reception - I thought the woman was going to throw something at me when i asked her a question on check in! Bar staff more interested in reading the paper than serving guests- although bar is not great anyway! Best part of our stay was check out because we were leaving! I find it interesting that no manager at the hotel seems bothered to reply to the guest comments on here.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly better than dingy”
Reviews.Author: kcpeppe
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotels.com. For some reason we ended up with Twin beds instead of the queen size beds paid for. Staff was very indifferent to the problem. But then they were indifferent to just about everything going on. So we were stuck. Breakfast was mostly eatable but you had to be careful. We had no problem going else where for breakfast I'd paid for it as an extra to the room charge. Saving point is location. It's on a nice side street only 2 blocks from the High Streets in the center of London. Easy to get to yet fairly quiet. It's the only reason I'd give the hotel a thumbs up. That and you can easily pay more for worse in London

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in the heart of the West End”
Reviews.Author: Roger00
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in the West End and were attracted to the HI Oxford Circus because of its location and the great promotional rate (- no longer available, my comment on price is based on the going rate). We were pleasurably surprised. The name of the hotel is a bit of a misnomer as it's about 10 minutes walk from Oxford Circus. A more accurate name would be HI Bond Street (as Bond Street station is closer) or HI Debenhams (as the store is close by)! It is in the part of London better known for its medical specialists (Harley Street area). The hotel is part of an older terrace. Our room was on the 3rd floor, quiet and clean. It was a little small but more than met our requirements. One nice touch is that the wardrobe had double wall-to-ceiling mirrors on the doors. The HI had the new HI logo, meaning that it had been enhanced above normal HI levels. This was largely true, though the TV was an old-fashioned CRT type with few stations - BBC1, BBC2, ITV1, C4 and Five, also Sky Sports 1/2/3, Sky Sports News and Sky News. I believe newer HIs have more choice, so perhaps these will come. One major plus point is that the lifts/elevators are separated from the corridor by glass doors, reducing the risk of noise by a huge proportion. We would hapily go back in similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EllenChr
Reviews.Content: The location is great - just five minutes walk from the tube station. We booked the room through hotelrooms.no and got what we thought was a good price (about 130 pound for a night including breakfast). Out room was quite spacious with grand windows overlooking the street. We were worried that this would be noisy, but it turned out not to be to much traffic on this street, so we slept well. It was very chilly in London at the time of our stay, so the draft from the windows was quite cold - but the radiator kept the temperature at an acceptable level. The staff at the reception was not very helpful or friendly, but the waitors in the breakfastroom were fantastic. The breakfast buffet was also very good with a lot to choose from. The water in the shower was nice and warm. It would though have been nice with some more toiletteries than a dispenser soap.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: WelikeHouse
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it is close to our dinner event. As it turned out, dinner was cancelled because of snow but we decided to travel to London anyway as we have already paid. The room is small with tiny window. The bathroom positioned its bath tucked away in a corner and makes it quite difficult to get to it. For the price they charged, you would expect decent toiletries. But all they offered was a dispenser-type. On the whole, it was not value for money and we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and old and dingy, but great location”
Reviews.Author: m00dle255060
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked much better on the website. It's actually quite old and musty smelling, the rooms are small and crampy.....and the staff on the front desk were often quite rude. The hotel was in a great location though...it was very easy to catch buses, walk, or take the metro to anywhere in london. And it is very close to some of the major department stores. I thought it was very expensive...we have just booked a trip to venice and rome and we are paying several hundred dollars less for each of the hotels than we paid for this place...and it is said that italy is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “High Price, Low Service”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxJester
Reviews.Content: The only thing that I have positive to say about my stay at this hotel is that the location is very nice. However, for the price that is paid for the room, I was very disappointed. Especially when the advertised rate does not include VAT, and they hit you with this at check out. I found the desk staff to be unfriendly and unhelpful. When questioned why they had to put a hold on a credit card, rather than just retain the number at check in, we were met with incredulous looks. No explanation was given as to why they place such a large hold on your credit card. Okay if you have a large limit, but if you are planning to shop with that card, it's a major inconvenience. Room itself is small, bathroom showing signs of damp, and really just needing some modernization. I will not be going back

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay in London EVER!”
Reviews.Author: PecosRiver
Reviews.Content: º This place calls a tiny room an executive suite. 12 x 12 does not a suite make. º For 260 pounds per night, they could throw in free wifi, but no, it's charged for every freaking minute of service. º Front desk personnel were mixed between helpful and downright rude. º We were made to pay halfway between our one week stay. Made us wonder if they thought we'd skip out on our bill, even though they ran our card when we checked in. º House cleaning packed our toiletries every other night making getting ready without waking your partner difficult. º The closet is only half the depth of a real closet and clothes wouldn't fit without wrinkling. º Terrible heating. Too hot or too cold without changing the setting. Very uneven. º Doors in this place do not close, they SLAM. º Thin walls. We could hear the neighbors fighting for 3 nights. Idiots. We will never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: DavidStokeonTrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends at this hotel because the location seemed very good and were told holiday Inn hotels were very good.The location is superb, being approx. 5mins walk to Oxford Street by Debenhams, where you can catch a bus to anywhere you want to go.The nearest tube station is Bond Street about a 15min walk from the hotel.We caught a taxi from Euston Station to the hotel which cost about £7 so it's not worth carrying your case on the tube. The rooms were clean and comfortable and we enjoyed an evening meal in the hotel.The following morning we went downstairs for breakast and were met with a queue so we walked towards Oxford street and were met with lots of restaurants,some of which served breakfast. We had ours at "SOFRA" which served a full English for £4.95 with free orange juice -a real find! which we visited the following day.The London Eye is worth trying, but we enjoyed the Thames River trip best, go to Greenwich for lunch and travel back via the "Docklands Light Railway" which goes right through Canary Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room, buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: michalz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a 2-3 minute walk from Oxford Street/ Bond street tube station, in a quiet Welbeck street. Single room is very, very small and need urgent renovation. (old carpet, dirty aircondition, dirty wall...) But very comfortable bed with two kinds of pillows. Buffet breakfast are rich. (Juices, cereals, hot and cold meals, fruits, varietes of danish pastry etc.) Daily newspapers are free. Wifi connection cost 3,5 GBP for 1 hour, 5,5 GBP for 3 hours. If you travel to London, do not expect too much from all of the hotels in the city......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but otherwise disappointing”
Reviews.Author: inspirala
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay in this hotel - but first time very big disappointment - maid service is not to the level for a hotel of this price range, rooms very small, tiny walls and the bang of the door next to our room was making our bed shaking... not every day we were offered new supplies of coffee, biscuits or shampoo...Rooms definitely need renovation! Staff is helpful and trying hard ... Breakfast overpriced ... No free internet I wouldn't stay again, especially for this price!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum and my Friend. On arrival we were checked in straight away even though we were 2 hours early. Check in was speedy. Went to our room which was lovely, spacious, clean and nicely decorated. Facilities within the room were more than ample. En suite was nice, with shower, bath and wc and some toiletries and a good supply of towels. Public areas of the hotel are lovely and the restaurant was great too......breakfast was buffet, you could choose full english, fruit, cereal, toast, juices and hot drinks, any amount!!!! Location was perfect , quiet street but literally 21 min from Oxford Street. Nearest tube was Bond Street. I will be staying here each and every time I go to London!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Low quality, no style”
Reviews.Author: profrompe
Reviews.Content: Small, poorly decorated room, appallingly smelling , carpet full of stains, loud, walls thin like paper, able to understand every word of neighbour´s phone call. No free internet access Nicely located near "Bond Street" underground

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some not so good points”
Reviews.Author: jtmom59
Reviews.Content: I was worried that our room with two double beds would be too small for two adults and two teenagers, but was pleased to find that we had (just barely) enough space. The beds were comfortable and there were numerous pillows (inaccurately) labeled with the degree of firmness. The bathroom was tiny and had peeling paint and a few stains on the ceiling, but otherwise clean. Weird feature: room key had to be placed in a wall mounted device in order for the electricity to work. Furniture was old, sparse and poor quality. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful, for example, we had a fedex delivery and they brought it right up to our room as soon as it arrived. Re: the internet, we used a nearby internet cafe recommended by hotel staff. Location of hotel was excellent - near loads of shopping, underground, busses, etc. Breakfast buffet was WAY overpriced and not too appealing. Better off eating at one of the numerous cafes on Marylebone HIgh Street a short walk from the hotel. I would suggest Patisserie Valerie where we had a delicious breakfast for less than half the price of the hotel buffet and it was freshly made to order. The menu was excellent and one could get just about anything. Also on Marylebone - Starbucks and a Barclays ATM (no charge for Bank of America customers, btw). For dinner or lunch near the hotel, try James Street - burgers and sweet potato fries were really good at Gorilla Burger and Made In Italy had terrific pizza and salads. Also Selfridges Department Store has an extensive food section where you can get drinks, fruit, desserts, sliced meats and cheeses, bread, etc, although pricey. The hotel has a small, but well stocked bar in the lobby and we found it very handy to buy a couple of beers there and bring them back to the room at night while we caught up on the news of the day. We chose this hotel because it was difficult to find accommodations for four in one room in London, and although it was far from luxurious, it was certainly adequate for the price (in London terms).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great service and food in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: hotfemale66
Reviews.Content: What more can I say other than the title? My parents are staying at this hotel at the monent, a trip I arranged for them. They have a lovely, spacious and well-equipped bedroom and the staff on Reception and throughout the hotel are welcoming, friendly and helpful. The public areas (reception/restaurant/bar) are pleasantly furnished and the food is excellent. The hotel is in a great location and other areas of London are easily accessible by public transport also. Thanks to everyone at Holiday Inn (especially Grace & Androulla) for looking after them. They are due to check out tomorrow morning and they've had a wonderful time! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Oxford Street nightlife”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkey
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for our work leaving party in the Loop Bar just south of Oxford Street. The hotel was only 200 metres away from the venue (being just north of Oxford Street in a quiet street) so absolutely no street noise when we got back to the hotel. Nice big English Breakfast in the morning to shake off the alcohol from the night before!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Kay030
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the worst hotel I have stayed at. I have stayed at other Holiday Inn's and have always enjoyed my experience but this was awful. The hotel looked like if was falling apart. Looked cheap and dingy. Our floor absolutly stank and the room was awful. The carpet looked like it hadnt been cleaned, paint was chipping off everywhere, bathroom lock didnt work properly and the TV was grainy. The only good thing about it is the location otherwise we would have left straightaway. Will not be going back there, no matter what the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, beautiful family-adjoining bedrooms, excellent buffet breakfast and incredibly staff..”
Reviews.Author: DebutantBackpacker
Reviews.Content: Despite other reviews that we had read and which had in turn worried us, we could not possibly fault this Holiday Inn in any shape or form!! From the initial booking over the phone to the hotel service including the bedrooms, buffet breakfast, location, pictures on the internet, baggage storage and tourist information... the hotel was top class! It is located so centrally that we never stepped foot on the underground, we walked everywhere, be it to the shops, tourist sites, or the West End shows. The staff were impeccable and very helpful. Breakfast was amazingly varied and plentiful and and kept us all going all day..! The location is ideal for anyone visiting London on a city break and who wishes to be close to basically everything! We had two really lovely adjoining family bedrooms whereby you could even choose which type of pillow you wanted; soft/firm!! We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Travel_relax_10
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel just of Oxford St.. It's situatiated on a quiet street (by London-standards) and the area has a lot of restaurants within a couple of hundred yards. The room was very nice for a long weekend in this city. If I had to say one bad thing about this Holiday Inn it would have to be the breakfast personel. They kept clearing our table while we were eating. Asking to take a plate where my food is still on is not okay, and they were almost offended when we said "No I'm eating from this plate". It was like they were told they had to turn tables and the faster the better. It's a shame because the buffet was actually pretty good. The rooms has thin walls which caused us to hear the ajoining rooms TVs but that's what you can aspect in London.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment - Expect Better from Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTurkey
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, what a disappointment. We have stayed in Holiday Inn before and this was a real let down. So much so, I doubt we will stay in another. Centre of London and they are cutting corners. We expected average for the price we paid, should of stayed in a 3 star and got better. 1. Air Condtioning had not been used for a long while and made the room smell musty and "foisty" 2. Towels - thin, worn and the loose cotton stands tied you in knots 3. Bathroom threshold broken 4. Ordered a newspaper - did not arrive. When complained to reception, they could not say sorry, instead "I will look into that" Remember - when booking on line with Holiday Inn, the room rates are excluding TAX. For £200.00 a night, poor service and poor quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for an outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraBrussels
Reviews.Content: A shame about this hotel. It is so well located if you want to spend some time in the heart of London... Very convenient for shopping! Reception area looks very old. The lady at the reception desk hardly welcomed us... she was very dry and stereotyped. We booked two double rooms directly with the hotel. The rooms were having old carpets, old furniture, tiny bathrooms (ok, I know, this is London) with outdated sanitary... The breakfast was ok - I was expecting worse actually! If they plan to redo the hotel I would definitely go back - I hope this has been planned. Cheers, Sara

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a nite in July 2010. I tend to agree with the other traveller review's. The hotel is in a good location, just behind Oxford Street (near to Debenham shopping centre). It is a good location for shopping as most of the shops closes by 8.30pm. The rooms are a bit tired with minimal furniture. However the price may be a bit low compared to the other hotels in the vicinity in the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “good location ,bad servise”
Reviews.Author: ronitp
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the end of June.The location of the hotel is good since it is located at small and quet street behind oxford str -the leading road to main attractions ,The tube is 5 mins from the hotel .The stuff at the hotel is cold and polite, yet if you need to operat your computer from your room as we did, you need to pay per the hour.Most similare hotels give it for free ot less money and if you need less then 1 hour you still need to pay it.(few pounds /hour ) The breakfast was english one ,which we do not like,and the breakfast room feels like a big kitchen in factory... so the rest of the mornings we went outside as there are a lots of good freindly italian cafee's with good breakfast instead near by. If you are looking for clean room,just to take a bath and sleep then this hotel is just fine. Do not think i will come back to this hotel as i found London very diff from what it was few years ago.There are alots of options if you are looking for good hotel in good price freindly and worm.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bert3d
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old and small, the beds small and hard. Walls were thin and could hear the tv and chatting next door. Felt more like a motel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+ ... but old”
Reviews.Author: zuerich_10
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel enjoys a very good location - right next to Oxford Street, but in a quite street it is perfect for power shopping and relaxing sleep. The rooms are not very big and might need a renovation soon, as the hotel is in a very old building. Nevertheless, the value for money is very good. The breakfast buffet is great and offers everything - from croissants to more than 7 types of corn flakes, fresh juice, eggs, bacon, coffee, fruits, yogurt etc. -> recommandable for people, who don't ask for high standards in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a convenient & quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Ocahan
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here after spending 4 hectic weeks travelling around Europe, it was a comfortable place to recharge our batteries. Hotel is around 5 minutes walk from Bond Street Tube and 10 minutes walk from Oxford Circus Tube. Hotel is close to major shopping centres (5 minutes walk) such as Selfridges etc. There are also a number of good restaurants and English pubs in easy walking distance. My partner and I found the Hotel matched our expectations for excellence in cleanliness, friendly staff, ease of check in, quality of meals & breakfast, we were also able to enjoy some of the World Cup games in the comfort of the small Bar near the reception. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this Hotel to family and friends and will definitely return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ingvalld
Reviews.Content: We went to LOndon for a few days of shopping, and to enjoy a musical. The hotel are clean, as we always expect from Holiday Inn hotels, and have a great location. We culd see Debenhams just down the street from our room window. The internet conection was however very expensive, the same was a quite average breakfast. The foreign front staff was always quite busy, and not as friendly as staff at other hotels in the same chain. The room was recently renovated and was very clean and tidy. We may consider this hotel for our next shopping trip to London, but will for sure make other internet arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be more organised!”
Reviews.Author: LindaColchester
Reviews.Content: Short walking distance to Oxford street which is a bonus but when we arrived at 2:30pm (check-in time is 2:00pm) to find that our room was'nt ready, Some of the towels in the room were not clean, and on the second day we had to ask several times for some showergel and shampoo as it was not topped up in the morning. The dining tables were not set out with the correct amount of cutlery, cups etc, we had to constantly ask several times over for the two mornings we stayed there. It was also difficult to get to sleep as the other residents continuously banged doors so best to take your ear plugs. When we checked out, the member of staff just checked that we didnt have to pay anymore then took the key cards, no friendly 'did you enjoy your stay' etc It used to be a pleasure to stay in a Holiday Inn hotel but the standards seem to have dropped, costs have been cut I suppose as the standards of food and the quality of the towels is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ajaykp
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for the Bond street tube and walking distance to Oxford circus shopping place. Hamleys,John lewis etc are all nearby. Good restaurants were also there at Oxford circus. Tesco outlet was also nearby hotel and was able to get some snacks as well. Overall it is a great location to stay. Interiors were looking little too old ,also without minibar,however it was spacious. May be we were lucky to get one as we arrived on a Sunday evening.Towels were not smelling good.Breakfast was alright with the regular english type. There is no business centre and wifi was available. Most of reception staff looked to be from Russian region and their approach was not pleasant. Overall i would recommend for everybody who would leave this hotel by 9 am and return by 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: kats111
Reviews.Content: I called reception and asking the nearest landmark to this hotel but was told just behind Debenhams. I told hear my location so I can gauge how far is Debenhams to where I was but to my disbelief reception just answered back just ask the people on the street where Debenhams is!!!!! BECAUSE SHE'S NOT SURE HERSELF AS WELL!!!! As a summary, hotel is pricey and not to the standard I was expecting as rooms are too small...... Lastly, staff in the reception needs training in customer service as they seems to be hard face and abrupt!....will not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Sightseeing and shopping!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayhappyWales
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very close to all the attractions of London. Checked in on time, check out meant to be 10am, had ours extended to 1pm at no extra cost. Would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ArielWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Smashing spot just 5 minutes walk from Oxford Street. We arrived at 11am and were able to check into our room which was a bonus as official check-in is 14.00hrs. The hotel was clean, the room was super, 2 extremely comfortable double beds with a choice of pillows - hard or soft. Tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was very clean. Breakfast is either full english or continental. Highly recommended hotel, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just a few minutes away from Oxford Street!”
Reviews.Author: dylanw_uk
Reviews.Content: This HI is located just a few minutes walk away from Oxford Street and is very near to a range of nice resturants and bars on and around Marylebone High Street. The room was a little on the small side and looked a bit dated but considering we got this on a bargain rate I can't really complain! The lock on the bathrooom door was a bit ropey too! Overall a good hotel if you're not looking for top end frills but want a location near to the West End shops.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: KP57
Reviews.Content: Two minutes walk to Oxford St makes this a good location for shopping and sight seeing. Use Bond ST Tube Station to connect with the whole city. Bedroom small but clean with tiny bathroom ensuite. Clean everywhere and efficient friendly staff. Yes we would stay there again if the rates were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_R_Baron
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping and nightlife. I often stay here when I'm in London. Some of the rooms can seem a little small, but it's clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no problems”
Reviews.Author: jennylb
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the less than complimentary reviews of this hotel I was very sceptical about staying for 2 nights there recently. Admittedly the standard rooms although adequate are a bit small but as members of the Ambassador Club program we were fortunate that we were upgraded and stayed in an executive room which was excellent. As far as the staff go, as many of them are from non English speaking nations communication was a little difficult at times but on the whole they were most courteous and we had no problems. The downstairs bar is comfortable enough for a quiet drink and the buffet breakfast was extremely good. One must realise that there are 1000’s of visitors to the UK everyday and it would be impossible to please everyone all the time, but a friendly smile and a polite manner will always get you better service. Whilst I am sure there are more luxurious hotels in London I have no qualms about recommending the Holiday Inn for a couple of nights, it is well located and the street is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but service may need to be improved!”
Reviews.Author: sillylilies
Reviews.Content: Rooms where better than expected, more refurbished that some of the pictures shown. rooms and bathroom were also was clean and decent sized for a london hotel, but walls are quite thin (as per most hotel rooms these days) Room service were also decently priced and overall it had everything you will need for a short stay in london given that the price is reasonable. However the location is a little bit further than what was said in previous reviews, its about 2 min walk to oxford street situated in a quite road behind debenhams and also the staff could be more friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: bardswalk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just off Oxford Street behind Debenhams. Decor slightly tired with standard Holiday Inn kit , very clean wit a friendly team. All in all a great hotel to use on business or for a leisure visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: Gasman28
Reviews.Content: Arrived for New Years Eve and was allocated a room on the fourth floor, classified as a smoking room despite requesting a non smoking room. The room stank of stale smoke and was very small with a double bed that was against a wall in the room which meant that you could only get in and out on one side, very inconvenient if the person sleeping on the inside wanted to get up during the night. The hotel was full and the only other room available was also a smoking room so decided to put up with smell and small room for the one night. The fourth floor is where the smoking rooms are so avoid this if you are a non smoker. The breakfast was excellent and the hotel was very quiet during the night with little or no noise from the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: ronandkristin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for it's location, expecting it to be a bit tired and in need of TLC. I have to say now that we have returned home that the hotel met and exceeded all my expectations. We were on the 8th floor and were upgraded to an executive room, which looked like it had been recently refurbished. It was all very fresh and clean. The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. The reception area is small with a small bar area attached, but this was no issue for us... we don't spend time there anyway. Breakfast was typical fare, buffet continental and cooked and all perfectly good. We never used the restaurant for a meal other than breakfast, however we did order room service on our last night. I would say it was much better than your typical room service, I had roast beef and it was delicious. My wife had Pizza, which she enjoyed. My only complaints were. (1) The reception staff were not very welcoming.. but i never really had to deal with them until check out. (2) we were in a joining room, and we had to endure a lot of child noise from the family next door. All in all we would recommend the hotel, it was good value for money and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: victorialeigh3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Oxford Circus on October 23-27th. We checked in late (after 11) and were given a room on the first floor, room 75. It was a good size room and I was surprised to see, it looked like it had been updated within the past year or so. Clean carpet, crisp bedding and a great shower!
